column1: #Text=In this study, we prepared two kinds of Sn1-xAgxTe polycrystalline samples with x (nominal) = 0-0.5, which are denoted as AP- and HP-Sn1-xAgxTe.
#Text=The AP samples were prepared by a conventional solid-state-reaction method.
#Text=The Ag (99.9%) and Sn (99.99%) powders and Te (99.9999%) grains with a nominal composition of Sn1-xAgxTe were mixed, sealed in an evacuated quartz tube, and heated at 600ºC for 10 hours.
#Text=The non-doped SnTe sample was prepared by melting the mixture of Sn and Te at 900ºC.
#Text=The HP samples were prepared using a high-pressure (HP) synthesis method with a cubic-anvil-type instrument (CT Factory).
#Text=The Ag, Sn, and Te powders with a nominal composition of Sn1-xAgxTe were mixed, pressed into a pellet with a diameter of 5 mm.
#Text=The pellet was placed in a BN capsule, and the sample was heated using a carbon-capsule heater at ~500ºC for 30 minutes under a pressure of 2 GPa.
